campaign.story:
New Stretch Goal Added! Tory Belleci becomes card #11. Details in Updates.
---
It all started in 2010. 
First pass at the Geek A Week design influenced by Art Spiegleman's Wacky Packages created 3/2010
In the late winter of 2010, I hatched an idea that ended up becoming, and still is, a large part of my life: Geek A Week.  I did 5 successful seasons, 4 of which were funded through this very platform.  I did several additional exclusive sets for Discovery Channel’s Mythbusters and it became a permanent part of my brand.  Geek A Week opened a myraid of doors for me creatively, allowing to work with and interact meaningfully with some of my geeky heroes. It changed my life dramatically. So it goes without saying that I wanted to do something special to commemorate the 10th anniversary. 
But it all really started in 1999.
Throughout the process, my wife and I were raising a family. A BIG family of seven children. My kids were growing up around me.  They witnessed me drawing some amazing people. They would come home from school and I would share who I was able to interview that day.  Weird Al Yankovic. Guillermo Del Toro. Neil Gaiman. Steve Wozniak. Stan Lee. It was mind-blowing. One of the kids who was observing all of this was my son, Maxmillian.
Maxmillian Circa 2003
 All of my kids were interested in drawing and expressing themselves creatively, but Maxmillian was different.  He seemed to excel at anything he put his mind to whether it be his artwork, writing stories or playing bass with his brothers in their band, Lumpia (named affectionately after the delicious Filipino eggroll).
Maxmillian and I in 2019

 Eventually he took up traditional painting in high school and his skills rapidly developed over the course of a few months.  Maxmillian is about to graduate from the Cleveland Institute of Art this spring, launching into the world as a highly skilled traditional painter and fine artist. He's amazingly talented and I can't do what he does. Here's a recent write-up about him. And here’s some of his work:
Alexa with Fendi, 60” x 48”, 2021, by Maxmillian Peralta
Dibbs and James, 60” x 48”, 2020, by Maxmillian Peralta
Lamar in Pleasures, 40” x 30”, 2019, by Maxmillian Peralta
The Scribe, 60” x 48”, 2020, by Maxmillian Peralta
Portrait of Mr. Patel (Employees Only), 60” x 36”, 2020, by Maxmillian Peralta
I had been thinking for a while that I wanted to commemorate the 10th Anniversary of Geek A Week with a symbolic changing of the guard. I wanted to hand over the reins to a new generation of artist. Someone with a youthful and unquenchable passion for art.  That is the basis for this project.  
We got you, Fam.
Preliminary cover art for Geek A Week Masterpiece trading card set
This is the first project where I’ve been able to collaborate artistically with one of my children. Geek A Week Masterpiece is a love letter to the reason I pushed so damn hard on this project 10 years ago. It helped me forge an identity as an artist and hopefully have it ultimately benefit my family.  Max has been following a similar path. And I am now seeing all his hard work come to fruition.  That’s what makes it so exciting to try to make this type of project go.
The core of Geek A Week Masterpiece stays the same: Maxmillian and I are doing new physical and digital paintings of geeky people and turing them into trading cards. The difference is, we have chosen some of our favorites from over the past 10 years and given them a new spin. Max has applied his reniassance style to a brand new set of 5 paintings.  Not to be outdone, I've upped my style and done 5 new digital paintings of some of my favorites cards.  The images below are still in need of branding and layout so the end product may differ slightly than what is shown.
 The list of cards is:
Jonathan Coulton
Paul and Storm
Felicia Day
Kelly Sue DeConnick
Kari Byron
Bonnie Burton
Trace Beaulieu and Frank Conniff
Veronica Belmont
Sumalee Montano 
(young) Wil Wheaton
10 cards for 10 years.
Jonathan Coulton
Paul and Storm
Felicia Day
Kari Byron
Kelly Sue DeConnick
Bonnie Burton
Trace Beaulieu and Frank Conniff
Sumalee Montano
Veronica Belmont
(Young) Wil Wheaton
 This time around the cards will be oversized, 3.5 x 5 which seems apropos since the physical paintings are really large and deserve to be seen as best they can. See size difference below:
A look at the size difference between previous Geek A Week card sets.
3.5 x 5 oversize cards compared to the original card size
We’re choosing to do a very simple reward system - a base set, an autographed set and versions of those sets with high quality prints.  We are also providing a few high level rewards where Maxmillian and I will paint portraits of you or even fly you out and give you the Royal Treatment with a pro photo shoot and a huge 60” x 48” physical portrait of you.
Simple Add-ons
We have also have a few add-ons that you can add to any reward level.  

 Seasons 1 and 5 of the Geek A Week project which feature 100+ cards which are also a playable game.  Add that to any level for $30 + shipping.
Seasons 1 and 5 of Geek A Week are a playable game designed by former Geek A Weekers, Mike Selinker and Kid Beyond.
 “Top Fragging” a 12 x 18 print based on the Valve game Counterstrike. Add it to any reward level for $35 + shipping.
Budgeting
As you can see below with our project budgeting, the majority of our funding costs are to cover printing, shipping, Kickstarter fees and taxes. We have sourced a Cleveland-based printer so we can keep in control of the process and don't have to worry about unforeseen circumstances. The sets are more or less done and all that's left is to set them up to get them printed.  Both Maxmillian and I feel very confident that we can deliver these new sets on time and at a very high quality.
All in all, this is super exciting and we can’t wait to get these in your hands.
Thank you for your support.
Len and Maxmillian
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have done these in the past and successfully funded and fulfilled all of them. They are a lot of work and both Maxmillian and I are up to the challenge. We have streamlined this project and if we make our goal, we will be able to fulfill this project successfully.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey backers:
I wanted to give a quick update about the project and where we are. But before I do that, I’d like to send out a huge congratulations to my son and partner on this project, Maxmillian.  On Friday, he officially graduated from The Cleveland Musuem of Art. Not only that, but he was one of six recipients of the highly coveted Presidents Traveling Scholarship.  This comes not only with the prestige of this valued prize, but also a sizeable cash prize. We couldn’t be more proud of Maxmillian for his accomplishments, but also graduating from college during this highly unusual time.

Hello backers!
We did it!  Max, Owen and I closed out the campaign in style last night over IGTV and read off everyone's names who backed the project and gave an individual thank you to everyone.  If you missed that live show, you can watch it here:
IGTV Live Campaign Ender
In the meantime, you've probably already gotten charged for your pledge. If there is an issue with your payment, Kickstarter will remind you.  Please take care of any outstanding payment issues ASAP, because if we can't collect your pledge, it hurts our bottom line. I haven't seen a report from Kickstarter yet, but hopefully there will be few issues.
NEXT STEPS

updates.update_userinfo: IT'S THE FINAL DAY! HOORAY! IGTV Live tonight!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
Well, we made it. The final day of this campaign. It's been a proverbial rocky road, but we’ve reached the end of it. And what a ride!
Maxmillian and I would like to thank all of you for backing and supporting us, so if you join us TONIGHT 4/8/21 at 9 PM EST on IGTV (that's Instagram TV for those who aren't in the know), Max and I will be thanking everyone individually who backed  and saying something nice about you if we know you personally. It will be a fun way to end this campaign and show our sincere gratitude for putting up with us this past month.

Hello backers!
After a marathon IG Live by Max last night and a crazy night of pushup rewards, pet rats and other secret rewards, (you really had to be there) we are proud to announce that as of 10 AM this morning, Maxmillian and I made our funding goal and we will be creating Geek A Week Masterpiece!
Both Max and I are thrilled that this project is funded and we can start turning our attention to fulfilling the project.

We are in the last 48 hours of this campaign and we have just $1300 left to go!  
If you've backed already, thank you for your support!  
If you've been sitting on the sidelines and watching this project, this is the time to back!  We are so close to funding and we need your support more than ever!  This project will literally go down to the wire and the next 48 hours will be crucial.

We have officially entered the home stretch, people.  This is the final week and final weekend of this project and we are just under $2500 to get funded.  This is going to right to wire, I believe.  And as we enter a holiday weekend, Max and I need your support more than ever!
Over the course of the next few days, you'll see plenty of activity on social media as Max and I are planning some things via Instagram Live and some other stuff.  If you've been sitting on the sidelines, now's the time to get your pledges in. Every little bit will help us make it over the edge.

We are in the final 10 days of this project and we've hurling towards 70% funded.  We had hoped to have been a little bit farther along, but we are still on track to fund 100% in 10 days. We're very optimistic about the success of this campaign,  but we need more support!
A few new reward tiers were just added this morning and a few reward tiers are ending this Wednesday.
First off, the orginal 30 x 40 paintings of Paul and Storm, Felicia Day and KellySue Deconnick are available as reward levels.  They are big paintings, so the shipping is fairly substantial.  That being said, they are 1/1 and orginal, physical paintings.  They were graciously donated by the subjects and they are really amazing.  If you are a fan of them, consider adding this unique item to your collection.

updates.update_userinfo: New Limited Reward Level Added - Vintage Trading Card Packs!
updates.update_content:
My mother died about three years ago...
Wow, what a heavy way to start a Kickstarter update. But I promise, this update will have a happy ending.
Every Thursday was my parent's day off.  On Thursday's, mom and I would usually do something special.  She would pick me up from school and maybe we'd grab some McDonalds as an after school snack.  Or she'd give me a half dozen quarters and let me play at the local video arcade.  More often than not, we'd end up at the local drugstore and she would allow me to pick up some trading cards to add to my collection.  I was mostly a Star Wars or Empire Strikes Back kind of kid, but I also collected Superman, Battlestar Galactica, Wacky Packages - anything that could be traded and collected, I was there.

campaign.story:
Slow Bloom Coffee Cooperative
Slow Bloom Coffee Cooperative is a 100% worker owned coffee cooperative, born from the efforts of the fabled Augie’s Union. And we have been working like maniacs to get this off the ground.
In the summer of 2020, the coffee workers of Augie’s Coffee (that’s us) attempted to unionize. With reminders to one another that it is against the law for employers to fire workers for unionizing still ringing in our ears, we nonetheless found ourselves illegally fired within days of presenting our union petition. This turning point set us on a quest to champion workers’ rights, pursue justice with the National Labor Relations Board, and fight to gain our jobs back or stubbornly create new ones. From battling internet trolls to relentlessly popping up whenever and wherever society would have us, we have been working hard to make a living for ourselves. Along the way one thing has become clear: with each other and the help of our friends, we can bring actual change to our lives and our cities.
So here we are, the newborn magic baby “Slow Bloom Coffee Cooperative.” As a cooperative we are 100% worker owned, each one of us accountable to each other in a completely democratic spirit. We have no bosses, only ourselves. And we need your help!
Starting a business is expensive, much more expensive than the initial goal we have set, but we need to start somewhere. To be honest, we need about $80,000 for one year of operation and this campaign would be a place to begin. We need a coffee roaster and a building to roast in and everything that endeavor entails. So we are selling awesome things that everyone loves like t-shirts, bumper stickers, and coffee mugs. We are offering you some even cooler things like fame and glory through personalized short stories, sweet lacquered plaques with your unforgettable name, and a literal Roast of you and your friends.
How can you help us achieve the co-op of our dreams?
 Create a Kickstarter account
   Log in using your email and password (or Amazon account information)
   Click on the rewards you so desire.
   Share our project like crazy. Spread it to anyone and everyone you know, or we might not get any of the money. This is all or nothing so please, go wild!
  What Will We Do With The Money?
 Buy a Coffee Roaster. Roasting coffee is not only how we make money in coffee, locally roasted coffee matters to the friends in our communities and it keeps dollars in our pockets and our cities. We have our eyes on a couple of coffee roasters that run between $15-20k. Our initial goal would cover some of this, but not all of it (not included in our goal is the cost of producing the sweet rewards for y'all).
   Lease a Building. We have dear friends helping us find a building in Redlands and/or Riverside, but they cost money and in order to begin roasting coffee we need a building to roast in. While we would love to return to all of our communities immediately, this is rather difficult. So we are focusing our efforts on one space that can serve many purposes: a roasting space for coffee, a kitchen for brewing cold brew and prepping other menu items, and a front of the house cafe to (one day later) build out into a cafe once Covid is under control and the world is safe again. For now we hope to have a sort of permanent pop up scenario in the building in which take away drinks can be bought and enjoyed somewhere else!
   Build Out the Space. Brewing coffee takes equipment we don’t have and adherence to building codes that, again, costs lots of money. This goal will take time and oodles of cash but we can use whatever head start we can get. Equipment we need includes a batch brewer, espresso machine, grinders, countertops, water and gas hookups, etc. All of the good stuff.
  Stretch Goals:
Every week we will be releasing new merch items to help keep the momentum going and keep offering you things we all love. The initial goal will be enough to buy a roaster, but not enough to build out a space to roast in. We’d love to have a space to roast, a kitchen to brew in, and a bar to safely serve coffee out the door until Covid is under control and we can think about having a cafe once again. If we can hit our first stretch goal we will keep the ball rolling to raise funds for the build-out of this space.
Sweet Pics of Awesome Rewards:
Beanie
Tote
T-Shirt
Super Special T-shirt
32oz Growler
Classic Diner Mug
Slow Bloom Trading Cards
Solidarity Card
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a lot of rewards to offer. We handle this by making several of them exclusive versions of retail items we would otherwise sell and making many of them experience based and easier for us to deliver on. The biggest risk you take in this Kickstarter is the timeline. While we are already operating and many of these products are already close to existing, they may take a while to ship. The kickstarter will run for about 60 days so you can expect the items to take at least that long. Keep in mind, these are technically preorders and we will get them out ASAP if/when the goal is met. Some of the experiences can take even more time if they involve a building or equipment. 

But all of this is overcome by loving generosity. The more this campaign picks up, the more likely it is that you will see your rewards sooner rather than later. Keep in mind, there are nearly 20 cooperative maniacs working hard on this thing to make sure a reasonable timeline can be met.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Tens of thousands already use Luna Display for Mac and now we’re bringing that same magic to Windows. Whether you’re working remotely, looking to maximize your workspace, or seeking more creative flexibility - Luna has you covered. As the only hardware solution on the market, you can...
Turn any iPad into a wireless second display for your PC or Mac
Connect via WiFi or USB 
Experience lag-free lightning-fast speeds
Use any Windows or Mac app
Utilize full touch support and external keyboard support 
Choose from two unit options for PC: USB-C or HDMI

More people than ever are working from home due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We're a fully-remote company ourselves — and have been since we started 7 years ago — so we truly understand the struggles of working remotely. That’s why we built Luna Display!
Life is better when your workflow works— 
Not enough screen space to work efficiently? Luna acts as a second display, so you can extend your workspace from your desktop to iPad.
Traditional monitors leave you tethered to your desk. But Luna works wirelessly over your existing WiFi network — so you can move your workspace around your house, to the office, and everywhere in between. 
Mobile second screen setups are often complex to set up and require lots of wires and tools. With Luna, you can pair a Windows or Mac computer to an iPad with just some apps and your Luna. No need to buy new screens - make the most out of what you have.




Luna works with any Mac or Windows desktop application —  

Luna gives you the flexibility to work wherever you want, however you want. Whether it’s stepping away from the confines of your desk to working from anywhere within your home, you can create the ultimate wireless setup with minimal effort. 
Luna will connect as long as both devices are on the same WiFi network. You can even take your workflow outdoors with a strong WiFi connection.

We've spent years building Luna’s custom video compression technology we call LIQUID. Every line of LIQUID code was originally written to meet the demands of pro artists, and the result is stunning image quality and responsiveness. That means Luna can keep up with any heavy-duty workflow.

Unlike our competitors, Luna’s custom-engineering guarantees consistent performance across all of your favorite PC programs. Enjoy the same reliability of a traditional monitor but the flexibility of your iPad. 


Take your mobile workspace on the go without worrying about a bunch of cords or heavy clip-on screens. Just pack your laptop, iPad, and Luna and you’re ready to go! 
Luna’s hardware dongle is discreet, compact, and beautifully designed. Unlike other bulky tech accessories that take up space, Luna fits neatly in the compact box that it’s sent in.
Each box contains a Luna dongle, sculpted foam packing to safely hold it in place, and a simple card with instructions to help you get set up in seconds.


Luna Display for Windows is available in two port types — USB-C or HDMI. 
If you’re a Mac user, Luna is available in USB-C or Mini DisplayPort (available for immediate purchase at lunadisplay.com). The USB-C version is compatible with both PC and Mac. 
Your purchase includes the Luna Display hardware unit along with access to the free Luna Display desktop and iPad apps.  
NOTE: Luna for Mac is available in both mDP and USB-C. However, Luna USB-C for Mac will only contain Windows support after the Kickstarter. If you choose to purchase Luna USB-C through our Kickstarter, you'll receive special Kickstarter discounts and support our Windows effort.  


Tens of thousands of happy Mac users have already transformed their workflows with Luna Display. Here’s what they have to say —
“Really enjoying my new set up, thanks to Luna Display! Such a great tool to expand workflows. 🙌”  —Travis V.
“Genuinely blown away by how well it works. Never thought I’d ever be able to use a desktop computer whilst laying on the sofa. Thanks Luna Display!” —Alastair M.
"This little device from Luna Display is incredible! It allows me to use an iPad as a second screen wirelessly with retina resolution. 2 min out of the box and up and running. 👍”  —Shane D.
“Much needed second screen for my 13”MBP when not at my desk. Big workflow gain. Works great over WiFi or tethered USB.” —David T.
“I just got my Luna Display in the mail, and it's incredible. Truly feels like the iPad Pro is just another monitor.” —Zack K.
“Really happy with my LunaDisplay. I use it constantly when I travel. Such a beautifully engineered solution, a real “It just works” piece of kit.” —Harrison T. 
“This device is such a game changer for me. For somebody that works offsite and needs more screen real estate in apps like After Effects, Luna Display knocks it out of the park. And there’s little to no lag because it works off a solid WiFi connection. Highly recommend!!” —Miles F.
“I can take my iPad and the mouse to another part of a room and control the Mac - perfect for home recording / microphone chamber. Luna Display is great!” —Hannes O.
“I’ve tried almost all of the ‘use your iPad as a second display’ options and the ONLY one that legitimately delivered on the promise is Luna Display – thank you for making this!” —Stephen S.
“Still can’t believe how solid Luna has been day to day. Literally feels like I’m using a retina touch screen Mac when it’s open.” —Daniel P.
“Just set up my Luna Display! I don't remember the last time I've ever been so excited about a piece of tech. My two screens and I thank you.”  —Lauren B.
“The speed and resolution are head and shoulders over software-only solutions!” —Martin L. 

Simply plug in Luna, launch the apps, and your devices will automatically connect! Luna for Windows is available for USB-C or HDMI.

Plug Luna into your Windows computer. (You do not need to plug in a Luna into your iPad!)
Launch the respective Luna Display apps on your Windows computer and your iPad. 
Now you're up and running! 


With full support for external keyboards, Apple Pencil, and touch interactions, Luna allows you to harness the power of your PC while extending your display to the iPad. Here’s what you need to get started:
A laptop or desktop computer running Windows
Any modern iPad
A strong WiFi connection or USB cable to connect PC and iPad 
Works with any modern Windows PC: 
Minimum Requirements 
Operation system: Microsoft Windows 10 64-bit, Build 1809 or later
Processor: Intel or AMD processor with 64-bit support; 2 GHz or faster
RAM: 4 GB
GPU: Intel HD Graphics 520, AMD Radeon RX Vega 3, NVIDIA GeForce 820M or later; or equivalent DirectX 11 compatible GPU.
Hard drive space: 1 GB
WiFi/Network: 802.11n or wired ethernet
Recommended Requirements
Operation system: Microsoft Windows 10 64-bit, Build 1809 or later
Processor: Intel or AMD processor with 64-bit support; 3 GHz or faster
RAM: 8 GB
GPU: Intel Iris Plus Graphics G7, AMD Radeon RX Vega 9, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 850M or later; or equivalent DirectX 11 compatible GPU
Hard drive space: 1 GB
WiFi/Network: 802.11ac or wired ethernet
Works with any modern iPad and Apple Pencil: 
Minimum iPad Requirements
iPad Mini 2 (2013 or later)
iPad Pro (2016 or later)
iPad 5th generation (2017 or later)
iPad Air (2013 or later)
iPad must be running iOS 9.1 (or later)
32-bit devices are not supported



Luna fully integrates with Astropad Standard and Studio — our award-winning drawing software that turns the iPad into a professional graphics tablet. We’re launching Astropad for Windows next year.

Astropad offers complete workflow customization, featuring a packed suite full of creatives tools like unlimited workflow shortcuts, Magic Gestures, and custom pressure curves. Pairing Luna with Astropad gives professional creatives the freedom and flexibility that their workflow deserves.
Count on your fingers to give you a hand! You don’t have to go to Hogwarts to use Magic Gestures. Save room in the sidebar by assigning frequently-used shortcuts to finger-touch and tap interactions.
Put the pressure on, or take the pressure off! Whichever way you lean, we’ve got you covered. If the automatic pressure sensitivity of the Apple Pencil doesn’t work for you, no sweat! Customize the pressure curve to your individual drawing preferences.
The curve settings in Studio helps you preview your adjustments, so you can better understand the changes you’re making. Test the curve’s pressure sensitivities at any time by pressing anywhere on your screen outside of the sidebar while the Pressure Curve settings are open.
Who said taking shortcuts has to be a bad thing? No matter what your workload might look like, we’ll keep up with you. Set up your perfect workflow and tool alignment just once, so you can come back to your perfectly-organized, on-screen desk every time. Free up your time and self to creativity!
Shortcuts automatically adjust when you switch apps, too. Even if you haven’t already established shortcuts for an app, the Studio shortcut sidebar comes equipped with the most common tools in each app to get you started!


We’re a small but mighty team of problem-solvers, creatives, engineers, and dreamers. 
Astropad was founded in 2013 by two former Apple engineers, Matt Ronge and Giovanni Donelli. Today, we’re a nimble crew of 16 people. Within our tiny powerhouse, we have a Windows-focused engineering team; a Luna hardware and firmware team; and a dedicated team of technical support experts. 
We’ve always been a fully-remote company, with team members located around the world. Because of this, we’ve made it our mission to build products that make life easier for other creative people that work remote. 
We’re a 100% bootstrapped company. We’ve never taken outside investment, which is why we rely on communities like Kickstarter to help bring our products to life. 
PLAY

 A look at our prototypes:
Here's a demo of the prototype hardware we used to shoot our main video:
PLAY



We are looking for your support through Kickstarter to help us pay for our next large-scale manufacturing round. Here’s what Luna’s development timeline looks like:
We originally launched Luna Display for Mac on Kickstarter in 2017. Our campaign was wildly successful, raising over $645K — 2,100% more than our original funding goal!
Now we’re back and ready to bring Luna Display to Windows. And this time around, we’ve streamlined every aspect of Luna’s production, so we can ship to you as soon as possible:
— Strengthened relationship with our manufacturing partner 
Over the past few years, we’ve cultivated a loyal and transparent relationship with our manufacturing partner in China. Before the pandemic, our cofounder Giovanni was taking quarterly trips to our factory to assess assembly processes and product quality. Over these many trips, we’ve built a strong partnership with our Chinese team, and they are excited to come on this journey with us to launch Luna to the Windows market! 
— Scaled up distribution to accommodate more volume and countries
Our distribution center in Atlanta, Georgia has scaled up to accommodate increased volume with our new Windows market. And since our last Kickstarter, we’ve expanded our shipping capabilities to over 55 countries around the world. Our shipping timelines have been on-time and on-track, with few impacts since the pandemic hit. 
— Tripled the size of our Technical Support Team
In preparation for the Windows community, we’ve tripled the size of our Technical Support Team. Timely and thorough responses are our top priority, as well as fully understanding our exciting new customer base. Our Support Team also works hand-in-hand with our Engineering Team for troubleshooting and providing immediate product feedback.  
— Hired a team of dedicated Windows engineers
To build the best product experience possible, we hired a team of talented software engineers that are dedicated to Windows compatibility. As we launch Luna for Windows, our engineering team is standing by to fix bugs and launch new product features!

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
— Developing cross-platform technology 
We knew that building Luna Display for Windows would be an uphill battle. Like all of our products, we started from scratch. This meant learning an entirely new coding language and rebuilding our core Liquid technology to be faster, more durable, and work smoothly on Windows. We also hired a new team of Windows developers to help us ramp up development.

— Getting to know the Windows community 
In our cross-platform journey, we’ve had to admit that we’re in new territory, which means understanding a new audience. As we make strides in delivering on our Windows promise, we’re dedicated to making our products better than ever. To better understand our new Windows audience, we’ll be conducting ongoing market research about how our users like to be productive with Luna Display. 

— Production during a global pandemic 
Now that we’re approaching the finish line, we’re cognizant of the risks of production during the COVID-19 pandemic. It’s our goal to ship Luna Display for Windows on-time, but the health and safety of the employees producing our USB-C and HDMI units is critical. It’s our goal to be 100% transparent with you about our production journey. We’ll be sharing biweekly updates through Kickstarter to keep you informed on our timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Luna Display beta app now available via TestFlight for USB-C backers
updates.update_content:
Dear backers, 
It’s time to start shipping some Luna Display orders! We’re so excited to get Luna into your hands and hear what you think. Here’s a quick summary of what’s happening in Luna’s orbit this week:
USB-C units will begin shipping this week
The Luna beta app will be available for USB-C backers via TestFlight

Dear Kickstarter community,
Last month, we announced that our Luna Display HDMI unit ship date would need to be pushed back to this September (2021). To recap, this delay is because of extra hurdles with the HDMI firmware. There’s a large variety of HDMI-compatible PCs (compared to USB-C-compatible PCs), and we want Luna Display to work with as many PC setups as possible.
As we round the corner to the finish line, we’re excited to share some HDMI progress notes with you.
Updated HDMI units will be tested on affected PC models

campaign.story:
※ The video above will play in English first, followed by a Japanese language version starting at 2:10. The story below alternates between English and Japanese so readers of either language can follow along with the corresponding images.
※ 動画は、英語版の後、2:10から日本語版の動画が再生されます。ストーリーは英語と日本語が交互に表示されますので、どちらの言語の方でも画像の説明がわかるようになっています。
When I became aware of hanafuda two years ago, I instantly fell in love. I collected a few dozen decks from Japan, some books about hanafuda and Japanese design, and hundreds of digital images. I went to Kyoto with my friend Airi to visit Oishi Tengudo, a company that has been manufacturing hanafuda for over 200 years.
2年前に花札の存在を知ったとき、私はすぐに恋に落ちました。日本から数十組の花札、花札や日本のデザインに関する本、そして何百枚ものデジタル画像を集めました。友人の愛理と京都に行き、200年以上花札を作り続けている大石天狗堂を訪ねました。
In hanafuda, there are twelve different suits with a flower or plant to represent each one. That's a lot to keep track of. Not to mention, each card illustration is unique. When I started playing some games with my friends, I noticed that new players often had trouble identifying or distinguishing suits. In an effort to make hanafuda more approachable for new players, I searched for an appropriate symbolic solution to these problems. 
花札には十二種類のスートがあり、それぞれのスートに花や植物が描かれています。 それはそれで大変なことです。もちろん、カードのイラストも一枚一枚が個性的です。友人とゲームを始めてみて気付いたのですが、初心者はスートの見分けるのが難しいことに気が付きました。花札をもっと親しみやすいものにしようと、これらの問題を象徴的に解決する方法を探してみました。
For hundreds of years, clans, families, and organizations have used mōn to represent themselves. You can find examples of these symbols throughout Japan on both modern and traditional objects, like drums, flags, roof tiles, kimono, cars, airplanes, and even in video games. Mōn seemed like the right direction for Junior Hanafuda.
何百年も前から、藩や家族、組織は自分たちを表すために「紋」を使ってきました。太鼓、旗、瓦、着物、車、飛行機、ゲームの中など、現代的なものから伝統的なものまで、日本中のあらゆる場所でこのシンボルの例を見ることができます。 ジュニア花札には「紋」が適しているように思えたのです。
As an icon designer, mōn appealed to my sensibilities and I became excited about the prospect of creating a system of consistent mōn for every flower, plant, animal, and object found in hanafuda. Every mōn in Junior Hanafuda was precisely drawn to complement each other, while remaining visually distinct for the benefit of players.
アイコンデザイナーである私の感性の中で、花札の花、草木、動物、オブジェのすべてに一貫した紋があることにワクワクしました。ジュニア花札では、プレイヤーのために視覚的に区別しながらも、お互いを引き立て合うように緻密に描かれています。 
In Junior Hanafuda, mōn for each suit are placed in the corners as indices, while the kind of the card is depicted with the color and pattern surrounding the mōn in the center. 
ジュニア花札では、各スートの「紋」が隅にインデックスとして配置され、カードの種類は中央の「紋」を囲む色や模様で描かれています。
 Junior Hanafuda is poker size and the card back design feels both classic and entirely new, exhibiting plants and animals similar in theme but not typically found in hanafuda. It features bamboo along the edges, sparrows in the corners, and Mt. Fuji in the center. 
ジュニア花札はポーカーサイズで、カードバックのデザインは古典的でありながら全く新しい感じがし、花札にはあまり見られないようなテーマの植物や動物が描かれています。外枠には竹、四角には雀、中央には富士山が描かれています。
The result is a hanafuda deck unlike any other. Each deck includes 56 cards. In every deck, there are 48 standard cards along with some bonus cards that allow you to play with up to 4 players. While no instructions are included with the deck itself, rules for various games can be viewed on and printed from the Junior website: junior.cards 
その結果、今までにない花札デッキが出来上がりました。各デッキには56枚のカードが入っています。各デッキには48枚のスタンダードカードと、最大4人で遊べるボーナスカードが入っています。デッキ自体には説明書はありませんが、様々なゲームのルールはジュニアのホームページ（ junior.cards ）で見ることができ、印刷することもできます。
Junior Hanafuda will be manufactured by The United States Playing Card Company in Erlanger, Kentucky. They are famous for Bee® and Bicycle® decks, and are known around the world for the quality of their playing cards. Junior Hanafuda will be printed on premium card stock with their classic embossed finish.
ジュニア花札は、ケンタッキー州アーランガーにあるU.Sプレイングカード社が製造しています。彼らは、Bee®やBicycle®のデッキで有名で、トランプの品質の高さで世界的に知られています。ジュニア花札は、クラシックなエンボス加工が施されたプレミアムカードストックに印刷されます。
The Complete Collection and Deluxe tiers feature a very special paulownia wood box, made in Nagato, Japan. The Deluxe tier also contains a signed, uncut Phoenix sheet.
コンプリートコレクション（完全版）とデラックス（豪華版）の2段には、山口県長門市で製造されたの特別な桐箱に入っています。デラックス（豪華版）には、サイン入りのノーカットのフェニックス·シートも入っています。
Junior Hanafuda has been very important to me over the past couple years and I look forward to making many more cards from around the world for you, your friends, and your family to enjoy. Thank you very much for considering this project. 
ジュニア花札はこの数年、私にとってとても大切なものでしたので、これからも世界中のカードをたくさん作って、皆さんやお友達、ご家族に楽しんでいただけることを楽しみにしています。今回のプロジェクトを検討してくださった方、本当にありがとうございました。
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All art is complete. The United States Playing Card Company will add Junior Hanafuda to their printing schedule and Woodnote will begin manufacture of the paulownia wood boxes when this project finishes and reaches its funding goal. BuyOlympia will ship the orders when the products arrive. (Note: COVID-19 may impact shipping estimates.)

While this is my first Kickstarter project, it is not the first time I’ve produced cards with the United States Playing Card Company. I expect that process to go smoothly.

すべてのアートワークは完成しています。U.Sプレイングカード社は、ジュニア花札を印刷する準備は整っています。ウッドノート（木箱製造会社）は、このプロジェクトが終了し、資金調達の目標に達した時点で、桐箱の製造を開始する予定です。BuyOlympiaは商品が到着した時点で注文分を発送する予定です。(COVID-19の影響で発送予定に影響が出る場合があります)

初めてのKickstarterプロジェクトではありますが、U.Sプレイングカード社でカードを制作するのは初めてではありません。そのプロセスがスムーズに進むことを期待しています。
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Anyone who has played with Bee® cards know that these cards are made to last. You’ll be able to enjoy Junior Hanafuda for many years to come.

Bee®カードで遊んだことがある人なら誰でも知っている、長持ちするように作られたカードです。これから何年もジュニア花札を楽しむことができます。
Reusability and recyclability
Both the cards and box are recyclable paper.

カードも箱もリサイクル可能な紙です。
Sustainable materials
Junior Hanafuda is produced on sustainable forest paper.

ジュニア花札は、持続可能な森林紙で生産されています。

updates.update_userinfo: It’s shipping day! 発送日です！
Printed! 印刷が完了しました！
It’s happening! ついにここまで来ました！
updates.update_content:
Hi! Here's a quick update to let you know how everything is going.
こんにちは！現在の状況を簡単にですが説明したいと思います。

Cards — Proofs are approved, contracts are signed, and invoices are paid. The United States Playing Card Company is taking an extended holiday break this year to transition their ownership to Cartamundi. Junior Hanafuda is ready to print when they return from their break.

A month ago, I was nearly tearing my hair out, stressed that no one would care about this project, but today, the campaign ended with a total of $26,415. This absolutely exceeded my expectations. I’m extremely grateful to all of you for helping me get to this point and make this project a reality. Thank you very much. I sincerely appreciate your time, attention, and contributions you’ve made to this project.
1ヶ月前、もしかしたら誰もこのプロジェクトに興味がないかもしれないとストレスでいっぱいで、本当に心配でした。けれど今日、キャンペーンは合計$26,415（日本円で約270万円）を集めることに成功し、全く予想外の金額で終えることが出来ました。このプロジェクトを実現するのに協力してくれた全ての皆さんに感謝します。本当にありがとう。掛けてくれた時間、興味を持ってくれたこと、このプロジェクトへの貢献に心からお礼を言いたいです。

Today I want to share a peek behind the scenes of creating Junior Hanafuda. I’m going to take you through what inspired me, sketches, and comps leading up to the first edition I printed last year (pictured).
昨年印刷した初版（画像）に至るまでの、インスピレーションになったもの、スケッチ、デザインカンプをお見せしながら、ジュニア花札が出来るまでの舞台裏について説明したいと思います。

I'm so looking forward to seeing this representation of the Hanafuda. It gave me a jolt of excitement to see it so close, and I hope you are enjoying your first kickstarter project as well.
Sorry hit post by mistake. When i said 'follow' i meant it in the sense 'actively be aware of every change we make'. It's such an unreasonable burden on small sellers.

From what I've read, even the old rules basically treated everyone as a criminal for exercising their right to import foreign goods, and the new rules sound like the UK is trying to effectively kill trade altogether. campaign.story:
First off, thanks for caring enough to check this out. Please spread the word in all the ways you can to anyone who might be into it. Like everyone else, I'm doing all I can to stay healthy, creative & sustainable in these strange & stressful times. Making music is the only real job I've ever had. It's also my favorite way to take care of myself, and offer love & support to the world. Like I wrote in the video, music helps me through, and I want whatever I make to help as many people as possible. I think that's what art is for.
It's been a minute since I've made an album. After releasing Me And You Are Two in 2014(?!?), I wrote a book about fatherhood & music, made a rad EP with J & Zach Jawbox, celebrated the 20th anniversary of Water & Solutions, updated my website (feat. a sweet online community), found a way to make all the different merch designs from over the years easily available, played a gazillion more shows... and then, just as I was getting ready to finally make a new album and do some touring around it, crazy-ass 2020 came along and turned everything upside-down. I try to just do the best I can no matter what's going on, so I've used the unexpected downtime to really think on what feels important and fun for me right now.
Over the years, I've realized that while I'll always love making stuff at home on my own, there's something about collaboration that lights me up in totally different ways. Right now, in this time of social distancing and the loneliness that can come with it, I'm wanting more than ever to make something truly collaborative. It's gonna take more time & money to do it this way, and I know it'll be worth it for all involved, including you. Speaking of which, beyond the basic album-related rewards, I focused on more personal ways of interacting with you, from making you personal recordings to helping you make yr own. If my ideas spark ideas for you that aren't included in this project, let's figure it out.
So yea, as for this album: I want to finally, properly combine what I love about my solo/home stuff with what I love about my band/studio stuff. Jeremy Tappero is the perfect partner for that. We've made records and toured together in onelinedrawing, New End, and Gratitude. In the years since then, while I've been doing my thing, he's become a pretty amazing multi-instrumentalist, studio engineer, and producer. When we were talking the other day, he said his favorite instrument is the studio itself, and it reminded me: over the years, I've figured out that my favorite instrument to 'play' isn't my voice or the guitar, but the song/idea itself. It's gonna be fun to join forces. We're going to make something I could never make on my own. We're also going to be bringing in other people to play & sing on stuff & be part of it. I'm not gonna drop any names just now, but if our dreams come true, some real neat surprises await. Speaking of surprises, if/when we hit our goal, we have lots of fun bonus rounds in mind.
Please be a part of this project. Please spread the word. Please help us keep going through these no-touring times, and enjoy a lot of music & ideas along the way. 
Thanks always & forever, for real.
xo Jonah
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've made a lot of stuff over the years, and a lot of you have been with me the whole way. You know I won't stop until I know I've made something I'm proud of. I'm keeping this one real simple & focused. I know what I want to do, who I want to do it with, and how to do it. Let's do this.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The PSONGS listening (and lots more) page is ready!

campaign.story:
Updates:
If you were lucky enough to grab the Kickstarter-exclusive vinyl variant and want to get a bundle and/or add-on items, but don't want to lose your exclusive variant, send us a message and we'll work it out!
STRETCH GOALS!
Thanks to our amazing backers, we stand at over 80% funded with 48 hours to go!
Let's talk stretch goals!
If we hit $32,000 by the end of the campaign (9:55am EDT on Friday, 9/14), we will record and release a digital EP called Shut It Down. Think Keep It Down but with horns, plus a couple other re-recorded WATU classics for good measure. Watch the video below for all the details!
Another new song??? You bet! Check out the lyric video for 'What's Wrong With Me?' below, right before you smash that pledge button!
Ready for the third wave?
Third perk wave, that is!
Introducing the We Are The Union Skacade Stick!
Display not included - but it works with anything that has an HDMI port!
Woah! What is that thing!?
The We Are The Union Skacade Stick is a one-of-a-kind, plug-and-play game controller - with a fully functional Raspberry Pi game system inside - covered in amazing custom graphics by the one and only Justin Gray. This thing is seriously awesome. Keep it for yourself, or make it the perfect holiday gift for your ska + retro gaming loving friend or family member. Works with any TV or monitor with an HDMI input (not included).
It's a new We Are The Union record, just for you!
Well, we did it. We made a new record. It's called 'Self Care,' and it's our first full length in six years. We worked really hard on it, and with the help of our amazing producer Jon Graber, pushed ourselves to create 12 songs we truly love, and we can't wait to share them with all of you!
Now with 100% more horns!
That's right! We've recruited the incredibly talented Jeremy Hunter AKA Skatune Network to join the ranks of We Are The Union. With Jeremy on our team, we filled 'Self Care' with all the horn parts you could ever dream of. We even brought on some friends to play sax and trumpet, including Vince Walker from Suburban Legends!
All backers will now get a digital download of "A Better Home"
So smash that pledge button right now to get your download and be part of the 'Self Care' crew! We'll send out your download within 24-48 hours of your pledge.
 "What's in it for me," you ask?
We're offering a bunch of cool perks, including:
What kind of exclusive content will there be?
Great question! We'll be sharing behind the scenes footage from the studio & commentary videos, as well as answering your questions via backers-only AMAs, AND you'll be able to participate in our game-with-the-backers livestreams! Anyone can watch, but you must be a backer to join in on the fun. There will be Mario Kart 8 Deluxe debauchery, Fortnite squad madness, and more!
So, like, what the heck is a "meme zine?"
The meme zine is part comic book, part zine, all meme. Flip through the pages of this absurdly hilarious, Kickstarter-exclusive, collectible monstrosity we've created and think, "what in tarnation is wrong with these extra-mozzarella-stick-getting ska nerds?"
The front cover!
These are just two examples of the ridiculousness that is the Meme Zine! 
Add-ons:
Just can't get enough WATU? We know the feeling! You can add the following items to any pledge tier:
Self Care CD - $10 + shipping
Self Care Color Vinyl* - $25 + shipping
Who We Are Vinyl - $25 + shipping
We Are The Union Meme Zine (Kickstarter exclusive) - $20 + shipping
Who We Are Cassette - $10 + shipping
"A Better Home" Lyric Video Memes - $25 (no shipping if purchased as an add-on to other shipped items)
* = Kickstarter-exclusive variant not eligible as an add on (you can add other items to the exclusive variant tier, though!)
To order add-on items, simply choose whichever tier you'd like, and then edit the amount in the 'Your Pledge Amount' box to reflect the updated total. Then, send us a message to tell us what item you're adding on to your order. That's it. We'll handle the rest. If you need more info, check the "How Do I Order Add-On Items" section of the FAQs! Be sure to reference the "add-ons shipping" link in the FAQs to calculate your shipping costs before updating your pledge amount: 
Self Care LP Cover
Who We Are LP Front Cover (brought to you via a partnership with Bad Time Records)
Who We Are Limited-Edition Cassette
Extra Mozzarella Sticks. Wait, I mean "I Backed We Are The Union's Kickstarter & All I Got Was This Lousy T-Shirt" design!
Get your name on the back of this tee by picking up any of the following bundles: A "Lousy T-Shirt" Joke? Really?; The Ultimate Merch Bundle; THAAAAAAAANKS!; or You Are The Union.
Wait, so you already recorded the album? Then what is this Kickstarter for?
Yep! 'Self Care' is already recorded, mixed, and mastered! We paid for everything up until this point out of our own pockets. Our goal is not to make a quick buck, or even to make back the money spent on the album thus far. Rather, the goal is to make the release of 'Self Care' something truly special, by functioning as our own record label - with all of you as our partners! That means we need to:
Generate physical copies for 'Self Care,' including vinyl & CDs
Create our own music videos, lyric videos, and other visual content to accompany the record with the help of our resident videographer, Chris Graue
Run our own marketing, and yes, that means paying for ads. It's not glamorous, but it is true. In 2018, cutting through the static of an oversaturated music market means creating some (hopefully) cool content and spending money to get it to people's eyes and ears.
Pay Justin Gray & Eden Kittiver for the art, photo, and design of the 'Self Care' artwork
Pay for 'Who We Are' vinyl from Bad Time Records
If we meet our third and final stretch goal, pay ourselves back for the recording
And of course, as with every Kickstarter project, we'll have to pay out nearly 15% of every dollar we generate, plus cover perk fulfillment costs
Don't you need to be signed to a record label to be successful?
We certainly don't think so. There's no right or wrong path as an artist, but to us, success is finding the best way to bring the experience we envision directly to you.
We want to control every aspect of the record making process, so what you get is an unfiltered, real work of art. If a record label were to get involved, the experience would change dramatically as we tried to fit into their cookie cutter release plan. The truth is we don't want to just sit back and expect a record label or a manager to make this record a success. We want the opportunity to put in the hard work ourselves and make this happen on our terms. Further, our hope is that we can, in some small way, shake things up and inspire others to take control of their art, too.
Simply put, this is our divorce from a broken industry that leeches off of the very artists it depends on. This is our declaration of independence. This is our Self Care.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It's hard to say what to put here! Since the record is recorded, mixed, and mastered, the only real risk is that production of physical copies or perk fulfillments falls behind schedule. However, the incredibly talented team we've put together to help us has years of experience with this type of project, and we've all worked together to create a schedule and multiple levels of contingency to ensure we are successful.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: MAJOR UPDATE! Meme Zine! Previously Unreleased 'Self Care' Song! Skatune Network Cover Requests!
updates.update_content:
Hello everybody! It's been a while! Life got a bit wild for us, but we are happy to report that the Meme Zine is OFFICIALLY IN PRODUCTION!
We had our amazingly talented friend Justin Gray draw this thing up, and boy are we excited to get it in your hands. According to the printer, the eta for completed production is April 23rd, which means we should have them in our hands hopefully no later than May 1st. As soon as we get them, we'll ship 'em out to you! We're not giving too much away, but we wanted to leave you with a little sneak preview since you've all been so patient with us! to see the final front cover, plus two interior pages from the meme zine, AND
Hello friends! Almost everything has now shipped!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Timeline Update & LAST CHANCE TO FILL OUT YOUR BACKER SURVEY!
updates.update_content:
Thanks again to all of you amazing people!
We’re out on the road with Reel Big Fish and Ballyhoo right now, but some rewards are set to ship very soon. Make sure you get your backer survey filled out ASAP so we know where to send your stuff!

updates.update_userinfo: Don’t forget to fill out your backer surveys!
updates.update_content:
'Self Care' is now available digitally on Spotify, Apple Music, iTunes, Google Play/YouTube, Amazon, Pandora, Deezer, Tidal, Napster, iHeartRadio, and more! You can even use it in your Instagram/FB stories!
Go give it a listen! Thank you so much for making this record a reality!
More info on CDs, vinyl, and other items coming soon.

Thank you, everyone! We hit our original goal AND the $30,000 SKAGGRO CRAG stretch goal!
All backers at or above the $45 level will get to take home a piece of the Skaradical Rock. If you're eligible, you don't have to do anything further. It will automatically ship with your other items.

With under 48 hours to go, we're cruising toward our goal! Now, let's talk STRETCH GOALS!
At $32,000, we will record & release the Shut It Down EP
Remember when we released an EP in 2015 without horns? Ever wondered what that EP would sound like WITH HORNS??? Well, now you can find out! Grab an add-on or share the project with friends to get us to the $32k mark, and we will re-record that EP with horns, PLUS a couple other We Are The Union classics for good measure, and release it!

updates.update_userinfo: Less Than 48 Hours Left and Over 80% to the Goal - Let's Talk Stretch Goals!
updates.update_content:
Very excited to bring you the second song & lyric video from 'Self Care.' Please enjoy "What's Wrong With Me?" and, more than likely, wonder what the actual heck is wrong with these ska weirdos?
Four days left in the campaign - still a little bit of time to grab that add-on or up your tier!

campaign.story:
Stretch goal update: if we reach $80,000, I'll hire a community manager for Micro.blog to help build a safe community from the start. See this update on Kickstarter for details on the stretch goal and a new feature called Safe Replies.
Hi, my name is Manton Reece, and I’m writing a book called Indie Microblogging. I'm also launching a brand new platform for microblogs.
Do you remember how the web used to work? How the web was supposed to work?
In the earlier days of the web, we always published to our own web site. If you weren’t happy with your web host, or they went out of business, you could move your files and your domain name, and nothing would break.
Today, most writing instead goes into a small number of centralized social networking sites, where you can’t move your content, advertisements and fake news are everywhere, and if one of these sites fails, your content disappears from the internet. Too many sites have gone away and taken our posts and photos with them.
I want to encourage more independent writing. To do that, we need better tools that embrace microblogs and the advantages of the open web. We need to learn from the success and user experience of social networking, but applied to the full scope of the web.
I first set out to build a new service just for microblogs. It has a timeline experience like a social network, with replies and favorites, but it’s based on RSS, with the main posts pulled from independent sites.
If you don’t have a microblog yet, there’s a full publishing interface with Markdown support and a native iPhone app. I call it Micro.blog.
The second thing I’m doing is writing a book and I’d love your support for it on Kickstarter. This short book will make the case for microblogging and show you how to participate in the growing community of writers who own even their short-form writing.
Some of the topics:
How to adapt blogging tools like WordPress and Tumblr to work with microblogs.
The important role of cross-posting to Twitter, and the best tools out there.
Tips for integrating your microblog into an existing full weblog.
The architecture for microblogs, with a behind-the-scenes look at how I built Micro.blog.
Overview of the latest IndieWebCamp and W3C proposals for indie microblogging, such as Webmention and Micropub.
Plus my own personal stories on why it matters so much to preserve our content on the internet.
You’ll get the book itself and early access to Micro.blog so you can reserve your username. Whenever the Kickstarter project is successfully funded, I'll start sending out invites to backers.
I love real books, too, so I’m even doing a limited run of print copies of the book in addition to the standard e-book. There are also rewards with Micro.blog stickers and more.
Over the last couple years, I've posted dozens of articles to my blog about independent microblogging and the open web. Some of them have even inspired others to write more on their own site. I'll be going through all of these posts to take the best writing — as well as brand new essays and technical topics — to put together this book. I'm putting everything I have into it.
There's a growing community and movement around independent microblogging. With your support, we can take back the future of the web from closed platforms and silos, and leave our own mark on the web. Thank you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Writing a book — even a short one like Indie Microblogging — is a lot of work. I'm going to minimize risk by basing several parts of the book on existing blog posts I've already written, expanded with new thoughts and guides. Most of the content will be brand new, though.

For the print edition of this book, I'll be using a print-on-demand partner so that I can deliver a fixed number of books without extra inventory overhead and cost.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! I've set a release date for the book Indie Microblogging: January 2nd, 2020. I'll send an email that day to all Kickstarter backers with a link to read the book on the web.
You can preview the draft table of contents here: book.micro.blog
There's a pre-order link on that page. You don't need to pre-order the book because you will already have access as a Kickstarter backer, but please share the link on your blog, to followers on social networks, and with friends who might need a reason to dust off their blog or even start writing on the web for the first time.

Here's a quick Indie Microblogging book update. A few major sections of the book cover the IndieWeb — technical formats and protocols, but also the history of the first IndieWebCamp conference and how it evolved into today's IndieWeb events.
Last year after IndieWeb Summit in Portland, I talked to IndieWeb co-founders Tantek Çelik and Aaron Parecki to better understand how the IndieWeb movement started and where it's going. I recorded our conversation and just finished transcribing it for the book, so I wanted to share it now.
You can read the interview here on my blog.

When I launched the Kickstarter for Micro.blog, I promised to write a book about independent microblogging. For the last 2 years Micro.blog has needed most of my attention, but as the platform has grown and matured, I'm finding more time to work on the book.
The book is not a simple how-to for creating a microblog. That is part of it, but we already have a help site with tutorials on microblogging. The book is also a history and guide for taking back social networking from massive platforms.

Last week, Jean MacDonald and I met in Austin for a couple full days of planning out the next steps for Micro.blog. I'm very excited about the new features that will be rolled out in early 2019, in addition to the custom themes and blog categories we launched just last week.
We also took some time to prepare Micro.blog stickers for sending to Kickstarter backers! I have hundreds of envelopes stamped, sealed, and ready to send this week.

Last month I wrote about our companion app for photos, Sunlit. We continue to expand how Micro.blog can be used for sharing photos on your own blog, including a new Micro.blog for iOS update last week with better support for non-square photos and other improvements. There's also a new 📷 emoji in Micro.blog's Discover section for finding photos and people to follow.
We've now added a new app to Micro.blog: Wavelength, an iPhone app for recording, editing, and publishing microcasts. If you've thought about starting a podcast but it seemed too daunting, Micro.blog has a new hosting plan just for short-form podcasts that makes it easy to experiment with posting audio. You can upload MP3s from the web or use Wavelength to record and post them.
Hello! A lot has happened since my last update. We've opened Micro.blog to the public and released a new companion app on iOS called Sunlit for posting collections of photos to your blog.

We are just about ready to open up Micro.blog to the world. Starting later this week, we'll no longer require an invite code. Up to 100 users will be able to register on Micro.blog each day. This helps us focus our attention on the community and take care of new users as we ramp up to the public launch.
I'm also excited to share 2 more things that are happening next month:
IndieWebCamp: December 9th and 10th in Austin, TX. If you'd like to learn more about indie blogging, work on your own web site, or just chat with me about Micro.blog, consider joining us in Austin. You can . More info from the web site:

updates.update_userinfo: Micro.blog photos and new Mac app
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarter backers! Today we're wrapping up the 7-day photo challenge on Micro.blog. The challenge was a suggestion from the community: @douglane posted to his microblog with themes to inspire more people to take and post photos.
I've loved seeing all the new photos. Here are just a handful of the many photos that have been posted over the last week.

Hi everyone! Over the summer we've been improving Micro.blog, with special attention to hosted microblog features like personal domain names and a new feature we just introduced: custom pages.
Micro.blog custom pages can be used for expanded “about” pages, contact information, lists of current projects, essays, or whatever you want to write about on your web site. Pages are automatically included in the navigation for your site.

campaign.story:
Hello World,
        For those who don't know us, we are a Pop/Punk (the throwback kind) band from the wonderful city of Pittsburgh. We have been grinding as an independent band for awhile now and have accomplished some awesome feats including stints on the Vans Warped Tour, tours in China, Japan, and Canada, thousands of albums sold all over the world, among others. We take pride in all of the friends that have supported us over the years and are asking for your help to "pay it forward" for our forthcoming album. We have a TON of HUGE things coming up in the near future which has led us into the studio with our best bud and producer extraordinaire Chris Badami (The Starting Line, Early November). We have worked tirelessly on these songs to follow up our last album, "Eternal Boy," and think that it is time for the world to hear them.
      Take a look at all of the awesome incentives we have for you on the right, and be part of creating the next chapter for us. Thanks for all of your support over the years, and get ready for what we have in store. Your Mom.
~ RB, JH, AM

campaign.story:
It is time to summon the greatest do-able vegan cookbook of all time.
This will be an ultra visual, multimedia cookbook to teach amazing vegan cooking with a fist full of metal.
Each and every recipe in the book will have an accompanying video.  You will be able to scan a QR code to summon the video for anything in the book.
I want this to be the most fun vegan cookbook  possible that teaches easy vegan cooking in a modern real world context.
Since I am also highly into personal development and mysticism... The book will be peppered with the most useful aspects of what I have learned from that world as well.
I am not really into cookbooks.
I don't like measuring shit, I don't like rigid rules, and I don't like people telling me what to do.
This cookbook is made for the person that does not like to use cookbooks in mind.  
First, The book is concept based.  You learn a concept, see one full write-up (with pictures every step along the way) on how to use that concept (the recipes).  Then you are shown many ideas for dishes that can be made using variations of the same concept.
For example, with the concept of mixing vegenase (vegan mayo), vinegar and spices many things can be made. You are shown a full write-up on how to make vegan ranch dressing.  Then taking the same concept, you are shown briefly how to make cole slaw, potato salad, jackfruit chickun salad, eggless egg salad etc.  

Of course, there is a video for each and every one of those.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First of all, I minimize some challenges to completion by creating every aspect of the book (besides layout). I write all the music used in the videos. I made the videos. It is just Me and a tripod. I write everything and do the photography for everything. 

This eliminates potential conflicts of rights arguments. 

I am working with a reliabable publisher for the printing of the book. The publisher is publishing the French translation of the cookbook while allowing me to go through them for a great cost on the printing of the english version. 

This publisher L'Age D'Homme publishes the french translation of many top selling vegan cookbooks such as Veganomicon, Isa Does it, and Thug Kitchen. That means they know what they are doing and work with the best. 

December should be a good amount of time for the fulfillment of these books and rewards. That is well within the lead time told to me by the publisher. If there are delays I will see what alternate routes I can take in getting the kickstarter rewards fulfilled in another way. Worse comes to worse, print on demand. 

If an incredible amount of books are ordered. I will enlist the aid of my current fulfillment house to help fulfill the orders and handle customer service. Of course I will always be available to deal with any issues that may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We are very excited to announce that after 8 years of being just a production facility, and a tiny one at that, we are moving, expanding and opening a tasting room!
Tour night
We are purchasing a historic house built in 1912 to use as a tasting room/Belgian beer bar downstairs, and upstairs, we will have two guest rooms available for a night or a week in Downtown Tarpon Springs, Florida. One mile from the shores of the Gulf of Mexico and the famous Sponge Docks. Tarpon Springs is also home to a number of world class Greek restaurants.
On the brewery side, we're going from our current 1200sf to 2000sf, which doesn't sound large but after working in 1200sf for 8 years...2000sf is sprawling! We are adding two foeders, two more 18bbl fermenters and adding a few parts and pieces to help with the bottling process.
Anne and Bob at Rodenbach
The showpiece will be the tasting room!
Once completed, it will be a replica of an old world Belgian beer bar. Antique bar. Uniformed staff. Proper glassware. Lots of small tables. Menu of charcuterie. All candle lighting on Friday and Saturday nights. Guest taps will include the best and brightest from Belgium and France along with an extensive bottle list and bottle cellar stocked with Shelton Brothers Importing's finest. 
Daniel Thiriez of Brasserie Thiriez and Yvan De Baets of De La Senne
Shawn doing the "shovel pose".
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our projected opening date is Oct 15, 2015. As with any construction project, that means anywhere between Oct 15 and whenever. We will send your thank you gifts in August but keep in mind the tasting room and brewery may not open on time. We'll do our best to give updates, pictures and maybe a few construction videos along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Saint Somewhere Brewing Company invites you and a guest to the private grand opening of Brasserie Saint Somewhere! We are excited to welcome our Kickstarter supporters as we share with you our tasting room and our new brewery location. Saint Somewhere farmhouse ales and hors d’oeuvres will be served. We look forward to seeing you and if you are unable to make it to our private event we would love to see you during our Grand Opening weekend, January 21-22. Please rsvp by Jan. 14.

Hello All,
Just a quick update to let you know that we have almost all of the rewards sitting in our home now.  One reward we are still waiting to receive are the t-shirts.  Most of you responded quickly to the survey, but there were some folks that I needed to follow up with before I could submit the t-shirt order.  We will start sending out rewards soon and for those backers expecting their rewards in August, you will now have them in hand by the end of September.

updates.update_userinfo: Image of Women's v-neck chart shirt

updates.update_content: Our t-shirt designs are in and we will be sending out surveys that will be sent to your email asking for addresses and your choice of shirts. We hope you like our new designs.  For the ladies, we have included the blue shirt in a scoop neck as shown and the chart shirt is available in a v-neck (photo of v-neck shirt will be added next week).  All sizes are available as shown in each photo.  We are so sorry for the delay in getting this out to you and we appreciate your patience.

After months of jumping through hoops, we are within a few weeks of closing our bank loan and closing on the two properties that will become Saint Somewhere Brewing Co.'s new home in downtown Tarpon Springs! The photo is of the house that will become our taproom and guest rooms.  The brewery will be located behind the house in a separate building.  All of this would not have been possible without each and every one of you!  Cheers to you all!

We are so thankful to all of you for helping us to raise funds for our expansion!                    
We are working on t-shirt designs and we want to give you a couple of choices to choose from.  As soon as the designs are ready we will post photos so that you can make your choice.  
We should be sending out the photos and surveys for additional information by the end of the week.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
updates.update_content: We made our goal! Thank you to everyone that pledged! You are all now a big part of Saint Somewhere Brewing Co. Can't wait to show you all the new place when it's finished!

We are $3000 from making our goal. If you know anyone that may, just may be mildly to somewhat interested in what we're doing...Please let them know.
Only 4 days left!

campaign.story:
Kit Lab is an online marketplace where brewers can upload their recipes to sell as made-to-order beer kits. When a kit sells, Kit Lab packs and ships the kits and splits the profits with the author.
As an author, you simply upload your recipe and Kit Lab will send you payments for the life of your kit. It's that simple.
8 Reasons to Love Beer on National Beer Day—or Any Day Really TIME
Will Kit Lab's Online Market be the Future of Home Beer Brewing? Eater
Like Blue Apron, but for Homebrewing Slate
Sell Your Beer Recipes Around the World with Kit Lab Food & Wine
Brew Me Up, Scotty PC Magazine
This Start-Up Allows Brewers and Beer-Lovers to Buy and Sell Beer Kits The Daily Meal
Make Money from your Beer Recipes, No Joke! Beer Borg
Kit Lab Wants To Be The Etsy of Home Brewing First We Feast
Etsy For Home Brewers Grubulub
Buy my beer! Would-be Brewmaster kits delivered to your doorstep The Would-be Brewmaster
Stumble across a good beer recipe online? Now you can buy it. The Homebrew Academy
Bottoms Up! An Interview with Kit Lab founder Ryan Sanders Traklight
This Week In Beer Brooklyn Brewery
Annual IMAS Contest Encourages Homebrewers The Monitor
 Kit Lab on The Brewing Business Podcast:
Brewers who want to shop for new, original homebrew kits will love Kit Lab. Since anyone can post kits to the marketplace, you can find kits from your favorite home brewing forum members, your favorite brewing magazines, and even your favorite breweries. The site allows buyers to find kits that have won competitions, subscribe to their favorite authors, and to submit feedback about purchased kits to other potential buyers.
Home brewers who have created great home brewing recipes will love to sell their kits on Kit Lab. Brewers can can upload recipes once and earn income off of their kits for life. The more highly rated authors' kits are, they more they will sell.
Organizations such as brew clubs, non-profits, brewing publications and breweries will all love using their existing platforms to sell kits and further fund their organizations.
Authors will be paid $1/gallon for the entire life of their kits. Sell four 5-gallon kits this month? We owe you $20. Sell ten 10-gallon kits? You've got $100 coming your way - all for that one great recipe you uploaded once.
Kit Lab is created by the folks that made Better Beer Kits. We've got some great experience with packing, shipping, and creating high quality beer kits that we will apply directly to Kit Lab. In fact, if Kit Lab is funded, we plan to just convert Better Beer Kits into a seller account on Kit Lab and focus 100% on the marketplace.
Authors retain 100% ownership over their work and can control how and when it is used in perpetuity. So when you post on the site, you agree to let us sell ingredient kits based on your work, but you are in no way agreeing that we have any sort of ownership over the work itself. So if you have the #1 most popular kit on the whole site and decide that you don’t want to sell it any more, that is your prerogative. You own us, not the other way around.
We want you to be selling by July 1st, 2015.

Want to sign up to sell on Kit Lab? Check out kitlab.co/signup

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a few major challenges that we have to designed around in order to get Kit Lab off the ground.

Stock - We're essentially creating a marketplace that will allow you to upload any recipe you can think of, which could lead to unmanageable stock needs. The plan is to launch with a base set of ingredients (for instance, only one or two brands of grain, DME, LME etc) and expand the ingredient selection the instant we can. In the rare cases where a kit uses a very unique ingredient, the plan is to source the ingredient as quick as possible and ship the kit the second the ingredient arrives to the warehouse.

Plagiarism - The recipes will be screened through the same sort of tools that college professors screen term papers through. It's actually really easy to spot direct rip-offs in an automated fashion, so that will keep the plagiarism down for sure. As far as small tweaks and changes? That's a bit of a gray area, but our feelings are if you've taken a recipe and put your own spin on it, you've added something original to it and its ok to call it yours. We also believe that the home brewing community is proud of their original creations and they kind of self police when someone does try to say "Hey look at this new IPA I made. It's call Bliny the Belder." That's usually shamed out of existence pretty quickly :)

It's also worth mentioning as well that strictly speaking, you can't copyright a recipe. Nor can you copyright/patent a common production process. So really, its not actually illegal to represent someone else's recipe as your own. Just a super dick move. And something we will not tolerate as moderators.

Anywho, the TLDR on the whole question is we'll have a very public frowny face regarding plagiarism, tools in place to screen the most obvious copies out, human moderators, and we'll feature the folks doing the best original work.

Transparency - How will authors know that we are being honest about sales numbers? Each author will have their own dashboard when they log in so they can view every sale they've ever made, how much profit they've earned in a given period, etc. So the platform, which is made from open source pieces (so not secretive and specific to us) is pretty darn transparent. That, and we're looking to foster an awesome community of happy, engaged homebrewers, and stealing from them would kind of run counter to that goal :)

Efficiency - Since each kit will be made to order and it will be impossible to pre-make any part of the kits, efficiency of employee processing could be an issue. We've designed recipe/order sheets that will help kit packing to happen as quickly as possible.

Shipping Rates - We'd like to offer the fastest and lowest shipping rates we can to all our customers, but until we start actually shipping kits out the door, we're not going to be able to negotiate better rates with the shipping carriers. This isn't as much of a challenge as it is just a reality that we've planned for. Shipping rates will start around $15 for a five gallon kit and drop soon after we start shipping at volume.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Rocky Mountain Sriracha was created by a group of student-athletes at Colorado Mesa University and a local entrepreneur, Chris Becker.  This all-natural sriracha sauce has no preservatives or processed sugar, but is full of flavor!  We are looking to raise money to fund the start of this business.  Specifically, the money will allow us to make a large batch at the Grand Junction Business Incubator.  This larger scale production will help us fill our first round of orders.  In addition, this money will help us increase our marketing efforts.  By raising these funds we will be one step closer to legitimizing the viability of this venture.  Thank you for your consideration.  Join our movement! A portion of proceeds from this project and future business revenue will be donated to www.DonorsChoose.org and www.MercyShips.org . 
WE ARE ROCKY MOUNTAIN SRIRACHA
Director of the documentary "Sriracha"             Griffinhammond.com "I am really enjoying it!" 
Katheats.com "Soooooo much better than the commercial one."
Rocky Mountain Sriracha uses only natural and organic ingredients.
Organic Culinary Garlic-From HOBBS Family Farm in Avondale, Colorado
Fresh Fresno Peppers-Rare and known for their sweetness
Organic Agave Nectar
Natural Sea Salt
Light Vinegar
We bottle RMS immediately after blending to give it the freshest taste possible.
Spreading the RMS flavor at the Southwest Arbor Fest in Grand Junction, CO in April 2014.
Rocky Mountain Sriracha goes great with everything! We dare you to try it on foods that you never would have thought sriracha would go well with.  You'll be pleasantly surprised.
Chicken wings made with RMS is a must-try!
RMS is the new sauce for pizza. Pizza will never taste the same to you again!
GOALS
RMS Gear - Rep your favorite sriracha sauce wherever you go!
T-Shirts available in gray, sky blue, and tan!
  RMS hat
